intro: Carex funhuangshanica, commonly known as the Huangshan sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Huangshan Mountains region. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. The botanical features of Carex funhuangshanica make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
